___integration_auth_token.description: Randomly generated authorization token, for authenticating genuine RetailOps- originated requests.

___page_token.description: Initially blank, subsequent calls will specifiy the value returned from next_page_token. Your implementation should encode any state information required for order retrieval into this value. If your channel order retrival implementation requires the data which is encoded in page_token, it MUST handle a blank page_token gracefully, and respond with a valid and appropriate next_page_token

___specific_orders.description: RetailOps may occasionally wish to re-fetch a specific order, or small group of orders. When specified, any next_page_token which is provided will be ignored.

items.description: List of specific orders which are desired to be fetched or re-fetched. Any filtering of acknolwedged orders should be disabled for this function

___channel_refnum.description: Channel reference number for one of the desired orders

___orders.description: List of orders retrieved from the channel. Cannot exceed 100 orders per request. Your implementation MUST NOT consider the order as having been imported until such time as order_acknolwledge is called with the specific order reference numbers.

___attributes.description: Attributes which pertain to the order

___tags.description: List of text order tags that can be applied to this order (array of strings)

___cancel.description: Indicates that the order has been cancelled by the channel. Used for cancelling orders in in Retailops that are in 'channel incomplete' status. Default is 'false'

___channel_order_refnum.description: Channel's identifier for this order. This value will be used for acknowledgement, completion, and other interactions

___ship_service_code.description: Code identifying the level of service. Could be generic 'Slow' / 'Fast' or Specific 'Fedex Ground'

___currency_values.description: Currency values which pertain to the whole order, but are not included in the respective item values. EG: if the item shipping is $1 for each of 10 items, for a total of $10, the shipping_amt here should be $0, and the per-item shipping_amt should be $1; If the order shipping is $10 none of which is directly attributable to specific items, then shipping_amt here should be $10

___currency_code.description: ISO4217 Currency code for the counterparty (transaction) currency

___channel_date_created.description: Date the order was created in the channel in ISO8610 format. Don't just use the present time, if it can be avoided.

___message.description: Optional message to record info regarding transaction.
___message.example: Gift card purchase for promotion XYZ

___payment_type.description: Payment type for this transaction. Free-form

___payment_processing_type.description: Indicates what type of payment RetailOps should record in its payment system. types beginning with channel_ are delegated to the channel for processing. Other types may be handled directly with the payment processor, if the account is on file

___ip_address.description: IP address used to place order

___name.description: Free form display name (up to 255 characters). If name is blank, RetailOps UI will display the option code

___type.description: Type of option, acceptable values are bool, text, and image.  If type is image, you must pass an image url. If type is bool,  pass a string representation of a boolen "true" or "false"

___code.description: option code, up to 255 characters. Will be displayed in UI if name is empty

___value.description: string value of the option, free form up to 255 characters

___sku.description: SKU number to which this order line item is associated

___item_type.description: Item type determines the behavior of the RetailOps order routing system. Use 'ship' for items you wish to be shipped by RetailOps. Use 'advisory' for items which are non-shippable or have already been shipped. Use 'instore' for items which have been purchased in a physical store

___sku_description.description: Used to describe the item in the case where RetailOps does not have a matching SKU

___channel_item_refnum.description: Channel reference number for this order line item

___next_page_token.description: In order to affect retieval of large numbers of orders, pagination is generally required. Your implementation should construct a next_page_token value which contains sufficient state information to retrieve the next 'page' of orders. This value will be passed in to a subsequent order_pull call using the page_token field. Return an empty string if there are no additional pages
